snippet: Critics are too mean. Except when they’re too nice. They stand in the way of art. Except when they’re irrelevant. A critic makes the case for the critic.
abstract: Dwight Garner Riff essay reflects on role of the book critic; says society needs more excellent, authoritative and punishing critics, perceptive enough to single out voices that matter and abusive enough to remind everyone that not every novelist gets or deserves a gold star.
lead_paragraph: Critics are too mean. Except when they’re too nice. They stand in the way of art. Except when they’re irrelevant. A critic makes the case for the critic.

headline.print_headline: ‘Not Everyone Gets, or Deserves, a Gold Star’
headline.main: A Critic’s Case for Critics Who Are Actually Critical
